text: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
speaker: Narrator

text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
speaker: Narrator

text: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, and Sabteca; and the sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cush fathered Nimrod; he began to be a mighty one on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mizraim fathered the people of Lud, Anam, Lehab, Naphtuh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Pathrus, and Casluh, from whom the Philistines came, and the Caphtorim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Canaan fathered Sidon his firstborn, and Heth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arpachshad fathered Shelah, and Shelah fathered Eber.
speaker: Narrator

text: Two sons were born to Eber: the name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother’s name was Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joktan fathered Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab; all these were the sons of Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
speaker: Narrator

text: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Abram, that is Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Abraham were Isaac and Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are their genealogies: the firstborn of Ishmael was Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah; these were the sons of Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine, to whom she gave birth, were Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan were Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham fathered Isaac. The sons of Isaac were Esau and Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Esau were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuel were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Seir were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Lotan were Hori and Homam; and Lotan’s sister was Timna.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shobal were Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon were Aiah and Anah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Anah was Dishon. And the sons of Dishon were Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ezer were Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan. The sons of Dishan were Uz and Aran.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king from the sons of Israel reigned. Bela was the son of Beor, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Bela died, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah became king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites became king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Husham died, Hadad the son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the field of Moab, became king in his place; and the name of his city was Avith.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah became king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Samlah died, Shaul of Rehoboth by the Euphrates River became king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Shaul died, Baal-hanan the son of Achbor became king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Baal-hanan died, Hadad became king in his place; and the name of his city was Pai, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Hadad died.
Now the tribal chiefs of Edom were chief Timna, chief Aliah, chief Jetheth,
speaker: Narrator

text: chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,
speaker: Narrator

text: chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,
speaker: Narrator

text: chief Magdiel, and chief Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah were Er, Onan, and Shelah; these three were born to him by Bath-shua the Canaanitess. But Er, Judah’s firstborn, was evil in the sight of the Lord, so He put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: His daughter-in-law Tamar bore him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Zerah were Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara; five of them in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Carmi was Achar, the one who brought disaster on Israel by violating the ban.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Ethan was Azariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Hezron who were born to him were Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ram fathered Amminadab, and Amminadab fathered Nahshon, leader of the sons of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: Nahshon fathered Salma, Salma fathered Boaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: Boaz fathered Obed, and Obed fathered Jesse;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jesse fathered Eliab his firstborn, then Abinadab, the second, Shimea, the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nethanel, the fourth, Raddai, the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ozem, the sixth, and David, the seventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. And the three sons of Zeruiah were Abshai, Joab, and Asahel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abigail gave birth to Amasa, and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Caleb the son of Hezron had sons by Azubah his wife, and by Jerioth; and these were her sons: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore to him Hur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hur fathered Uri, and Uri fathered Bezalel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later, Hezron had relations with the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he married when he was sixty years old; and she bore to him Segub.
speaker: Narrator

text: Segub fathered Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Geshur and Aram took the villages of Jair from them, with Kenath and its villages, sixty settlements. All of these were the sons of Machir, the father of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the death of Hezron in Caleb-ephrathah, Abijah, Hezron’s wife, bore to him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Jerahmeel, the firstborn of Hezron, were Ram the firstborn, then Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ram, the firstborn of Jerahmeel, were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada. And the sons of Shammai were Nadab and Abishur.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of Abishur’s wife was Abihail, and she bore to him Ahban and Molid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Nadab were Seled and Appaim, and Seled died without sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Appaim was Ishi. And the son of Ishi was Sheshan, and the son of Sheshan, Ahlai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jada the brother of Shammai were Jether and Jonathan, and Jether died without sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jonathan were Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Sheshan had no sons, only daughters. Sheshan also had an Egyptian servant, whose name was Jarha.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sheshan gave his daughter to his servant Jarha in marriage, and she bore to him Attai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai fathered Nathan, Nathan fathered Zabad,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zabad fathered Ephlal, Ephlal fathered Obed,
speaker: Narrator

text: Obed fathered Jehu, Jehu fathered Azariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah fathered Helez, Helez fathered Eleasah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleasah fathered Sismai, Sismai fathered Shallum,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum fathered Jekamiah, and Jekamiah fathered Elishama.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Caleb, the brother of Jerahmeel, were Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph; and his son was Mareshah, the father of Hebron.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hebron were Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shema fathered Raham, the father of Jorkeam; and Rekem fathered Shammai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Bethzur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, gave birth to Haran, Moza, and Gazez; and Haran fathered Gazez.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jahdai were Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Maacah, Caleb’s concubine, gave birth to Sheber and Tirhanah.
speaker: Narrator

text: She also gave birth to Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbena and the father of Gibea; and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were the sons of Caleb.
The sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, were Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth-gader.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim had sons: Haroeh, half of the Manahathites,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the families of Kiriath-jearim: the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; from these came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Salma were Bethlehem and the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families of scribes who lived at Jabez were the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and the Sucathites. Those are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these were the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: the firstborn was Amnon, by Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second was Daniel, by Abigail the Carmelitess;
speaker: Narrator

text: the third was Absalom the son of Maacah, the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth was Adonijah the son of Haggith;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth was Shephatiah, by Abital; the sixth was Ithream, by his wife Eglah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six were born to him in Hebron, and he reigned there for seven years and six months. And in Jerusalem he reigned for thirty-three years.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon, four by Bath-shua the daughter of Ammiel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of these were the sons of David, besides the sons of the concubines; and Tamar was their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Solomon’s son was Rehoboam, then Abijah was his son, Asa, his son, Jehoshaphat, his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joram, his son, Ahaziah, his son, Joash, his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Amaziah, his son, Azariah, his son, Jotham, his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz, his son, Hezekiah, his son, Manasseh, his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Amon, his son, and Josiah, his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Josiah were Johanan, the firstborn, the second was Jehoiakim, the third, Zedekiah, and the fourth, Shallum.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehoiakim were his son Jeconiah and his son Zedekiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jeconiah, the prisoner, were his son Shealtiel
speaker: Narrator

text: and Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Pedaiah were Zerubbabel and Shimei. And the sons of Zerubbabel were Meshullam and Hananiah, and Shelomith was their sister;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed, five.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hananiah were Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shecaniah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Shecaniah were Shemaiah, and the sons of Shemaiah: Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat, six.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Neariah were Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elioenai were Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani, seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah were Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reaiah the son of Shobal fathered Jahath, and Jahath fathered Ahumai and Lahad. These were the families of the Zorathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash; and the name of their sister was Hazzelelponi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These were the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashhur, the father of Tekoa, had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Naarah bore to him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar, and Ethnan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Koz fathered Anub and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel, the son of Harum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jabez was more honorable than his brothers, and his mother named him Jabez, saying, “Because I gave birth to him in pain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, “Oh that You would greatly bless me and extend my border, and that Your hand might be with me, and that You would keep me from harm so that it would not hurt me!” And God brought about what he requested.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chelub the brother of Shuhah fathered Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eshton fathered Beth-rapha and Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir-nahash. These are the men of Recah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Kenaz were Othniel and Seraiah. And the sons of Othniel were Hathath and Meonothai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meonothai fathered Ophrah, and Seraiah fathered Joab the father of Ge-harashim, for they were craftsmen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh were Iru, Elah, and Naam; and the son of Elah was Kenaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehallelel were Ziph and Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ezrah were Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. And Mered’s wife conceived and gave birth to Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: (His Jewish wife gave birth to Jered, the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.) These were the sons of Bithia the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered married.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of the wife of Hodiah, the sister of Naham, were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shimon were Amnon and Rinnah, and Benhanan and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were Zoheth and Ben-zoheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shelah the son of Judah were Er the father of Lecah and Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of the linen workers at Beth-ashbea;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jokim, the men of Cozeba, Joash, Saraph, who ruled in Moab, and Jashubi-lehem. And the records are ancient.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the potters and the inhabitants of Netaim and Gederah; they lived there with the king for his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Simeon were Nemuel and Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul;
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum was his son, Mibsam his son, and Mishma his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Mishma were Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son, and Shimei his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brothers did not have many sons, nor did all their family increase like the sons of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They lived in Beersheba, Moladah, and Hazar-shual,
speaker: Narrator

text: in Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susim, Beth-biri, and Shaaraim. These were their cities until the reign of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan, five cities,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all their settlements that were around the same cities as far as Baal. These were their dwellings, and they have their genealogy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah the son of Amaziah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel, Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah—
speaker: Narrator

text: these mentioned by name were leaders in their families; and their fathers’ houses spread out greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went to the entrance of Gedor, as far as the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: They found pasture that was rich and good, and the land was spread out on both sides, and peaceful and undisturbed; for those who lived there previously were Hamites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These people, recorded by name, came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and they attacked their tents and the Meunites who were found there, and utterly destroyed them to this day; and they lived in their place, because there was pasture there for their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: From them, from the sons of Simeon, five hundred men went to Mount Seir, with Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, as their leaders.
speaker: Narrator

text: They destroyed the remnant of the Amalekites who escaped, and they have lived there to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn, but because he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph, the son of Israel; so he is not enrolled in the genealogy according to the birthright.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though Judah prevailed over his brothers, and from him came the leader, yet the birthright belonged to Joseph),
speaker: Narrator

text: the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel were Hanoch and Pallu, and Hezron and Carmi.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Joel were Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Beerah his son, whom Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria took into exile; he was leader of the Reubenites.
speaker: Narrator

text: His relatives by their families, in the genealogy of their generations, were Jeiel the chief, then Zechariah
speaker: Narrator

text: and Bela, the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who lived in Aroer, as far as Nebo and Baal-meon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Toward the east he settled as far as the entrance of the wilderness from the river Euphrates, because their livestock had increased in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the days of Saul they made war with the Hagrites, who fell by their hand, so that they occupied their tents throughout the land east of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Gad lived opposite them in the land of Bashan, as far as Salecah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel was the head and Shapham the second, then Janai and Shaphat in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their relatives of their fathers’ households were Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber, seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: They lived in Gilead, in Bashan and in its towns, and in all the pasture lands of Sharon, as far as their borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of these were enrolled in the genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuben, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, consisting of valiant men, men who carried shield and sword and shot with a bow and were skillful in battle, totaled 44,760 who went to war.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made war against the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were helped against them, and the Hagrites and all who were with them were handed over to them; for they cried out to God in the battle, and He answered their prayers because they trusted in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took away their livestock: their fifty thousand camels, 250,000 sheep, and two thousand donkeys; and a hundred thousand people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many fell mortally wounded, because the war was of God. And they settled in their place until the exile.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of the half-tribe of Manasseh lived in the land; from Bashan to Baal-hermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon they were numerous.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the heads of their fathers’ households: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, valiant mighty men, famous men, heads of their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were untrue to the God of their fathers and prostituted themselves with the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul, king of Assyria, that is, the spirit of Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria, and he took them into exile, namely the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, and brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and to the river of Gozan, where they are to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Levi were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Amram were Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. And the sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar fathered Phinehas, Phinehas fathered Abishua,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishua fathered Bukki, Bukki fathered Uzzi,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzzi fathered Zerahiah, Zerahiah fathered Meraioth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Meraioth fathered Amariah, Amariah fathered Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahitub fathered Zadok, Zadok fathered Ahimaaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahimaaz fathered Azariah, Azariah fathered Johanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Johanan fathered Azariah (it was he who served as the priest in the house which Solomon built in Jerusalem),
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah fathered Amariah, Amariah fathered Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahitub fathered Zadok, Zadok fathered Shallum,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum fathered Hilkiah, Hilkiah fathered Azariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah fathered Seraiah, and Seraiah fathered Jehozadak;
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehozadak went along when the Lord led Judah and Jerusalem into exile by Nebuchadnezzar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Levi were Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. And these are the families of the Levites according to their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, and Jeatherai his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath were Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elkanah were Amasai and Ahimoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for Elkanah, the sons of Elkanah were Zophai his son, Nahath his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, and Elkanah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Samuel were Joel, the firstborn, and Abijah, the second.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari were Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, and Asaiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the ones whom David appointed over the service of song in the house of the Lord, after the ark rested there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were ministering in song in front of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting until Solomon’s building of the house of the Lord in Jerusalem; and they served in their office according to their order.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the ones who served with their sons: From the sons of the Kohathites were Heman the singer, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heman’s brother Asaph stood at his right hand, Asaph the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the left hand were their kinsmen the sons of Merari: Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their kinsmen the Levites were appointed for all the service of the tabernacle of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Aaron and his sons offered on the altar of burnt offering and on the altar of incense, for all the work of the Most Holy Place, and to make atonement for Israel, in accordance with everything that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zadok his son, and Ahimaaz his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are their settlements according to their camps within their borders. To the sons of Aaron of the families of the Kohathites (for theirs was the first lot),
speaker: Narrator

text: to them they gave Hebron in the land of Judah and its pasture lands around it;
speaker: Narrator

text: but they gave the fields of the city and its settlements to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Aaron they gave the following cities of refuge: Hebron, Libnah together with its pasture lands, Jattir, Eshtemoa with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hilen with its pasture lands, Debir with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashan with its pasture lands, and Beth-shemesh with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the tribe of Benjamin: Geba with its pasture lands, Allemeth with its pasture lands, and Anathoth with its pasture lands. Their cities throughout their families were thirteen cities in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then to the rest of the sons of Kohath were given by lot, from the family of the tribe, from the half-tribe, the half of Manasseh, ten cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Gershom, according to their families, were given from the tribe of Issachar, the tribe of Asher, the tribe of Naphtali, and the tribe of Manasseh, thirteen cities in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Merari were given by lot, according to their families, from the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad, and the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sons of Israel gave the Levites the cities with their pasture lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave by lot from the tribe of the sons of Judah, the tribe of the sons of Simeon, and the tribe of the sons of Benjamin, these cities which are mentioned by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now some of the families of the sons of Kohath had cities of their territory from the tribe of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave to them the following cities of refuge: Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim with its pasture lands, Gezer with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jokmeam with its pasture lands, Beth-horon with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Aijalon with its pasture lands, and Gath-rimmon with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the half-tribe of Manasseh: Aner with its pasture lands and Bileam with its pasture lands, for the rest of the family of the sons of Kohath.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Gershom were given, from the family of the half-tribe of Manasseh: Golan in Bashan with its pasture lands and Ashtaroth with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the tribe of Issachar: Kedesh with its pasture lands, Daberath with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ramoth with its pasture lands, and Anem with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the tribe of Asher: Mashal with its pasture lands, Abdon with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hukok with its pasture lands, and Rehob with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee with its pasture lands, Hammon with its pasture lands, and Kiriathaim with its pasture lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the rest of the Levites, the sons of Merari, were given, from the tribe of Zebulun: Rimmono with its pasture lands, Tabor with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: and beyond the Jordan at Jericho, on the east side of the Jordan, were given them, from the tribe of Reuben: Bezer in the wilderness with its pasture lands, Jahzah with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedemoth with its pasture lands, and Mephaath with its pasture lands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead with its pasture lands, Mahanaim with its pasture lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon with its pasture lands, and Jazer with its pasture lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Issachar were four: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Tola were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Samuel, heads of their fathers’ households. The sons of Tola were valiant warriors in their generations. Their number in the days of David was 22,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Uzzi was Izrahiah. And the sons of Izrahiah were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah; all five of them were chief men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with them by their generations according to their fathers’ households were thirty-six thousand troops of the army for war; for they had many wives and sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their relatives among all the families of Issachar were valiant warriors, registered by genealogy, eighty-seven thousand in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benjamin had three sons: Bela, Becher, and Jediael.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Bela were five: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri. They were heads of fathers’ households, valiant warriors, 22,034 registered by genealogy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Becher were Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Becher.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were registered by genealogy according to their generations, heads of their fathers’ households, 20,200 valiant warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Jediael was Bilhan. And the sons of Bilhan were Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were sons of Jediael, according to the heads of their fathers’ households, 17,200 valiant warriors who were ready to go out with the army to war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shuppim and Huppim were the sons of Ir; Hushim was the son of Aher.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Naphtali were Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Manasseh were Asriel, to whom his Aramean concubine gave birth; she also gave birth to Machir, the father of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Machir took a wife from Huppim and Shuppim, whose name was Maacah. And the name of the second was Zelophehad, and Zelophehad had daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Maacah the wife of Machir gave birth to a son, and she named him Peresh; the name of his brother was Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Ulam was Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: His sister Hammolecheth gave birth to Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ephraim were Shuthelah and Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zabad his son, Shuthelah his son, and Ezer and Elead, whom the men of Gath who were born in the land killed, because they came down to take their livestock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their father Ephraim mourned for many days, and his relatives came to comfort him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he went in to his wife, and she conceived and gave birth to a son, and he named him Beriah, because misfortune had come upon his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: His daughter was Sheerah, who built lower and upper Beth-horon, as well as Uzzen-sheerah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rephah was his son along with Resheph, Telah his son, Tahan his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Non his son, and Joshua his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their possessions and dwelling places were Bethel with its towns, and to the east, Naaran, and to the west, Gezer with its towns, and Shechem with its towns, as far as Ayyah with its towns,
speaker: Narrator

text: and along the borders of the sons of Manasseh, Beth-shean with its towns, Taanach with its towns, Megiddo with its towns, and Dor with its towns. In these regions lived the sons of Joseph the son of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Asher were Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah, and Serah was their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Beriah were Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heber fathered Japhlet, Shomer, and Hotham, and their sister Shua.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Japhlet were Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These were the sons of Japhlet.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemer were Ahi and Rohgah, and Jehubbah and Aram.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of his brother Helem were Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Zophah were Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jether were Jephunneh, Pispa, and Ara.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ulla were Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the sons of Asher, heads of the fathers’ houses, choice, valiant mighty men, and heads of the leaders. And the number of them registered by genealogy for service in war was twenty-six thousand men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Benjamin fathered Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bela had sons: Addar, Gera, Abihud,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Ehud: these are the heads of fathers’ households of the inhabitants of Geba, and they took them into exile to Manahath,
speaker: Narrator

text: namely, Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera—he exiled them; and he fathered Uzza and Ahihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shaharaim fathered children in the country of Moab after he had sent his wives Hushim and Baara away.
speaker: Narrator

text: By Hodesh his wife he fathered Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeuz, Sachia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: By Hushim he fathered Abitub and Elpaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elpaal were Eber, Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod, with its towns;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Beriah and Shema, who were heads of fathers’ households of the inhabitants of Aijalon, who put the inhabitants of Gath to flight;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ahio, Shashak, and Jeremoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
speaker: Narrator

text: Michael, Ishpah, and Joha were the sons of Beriah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abdon, Zichri, Hanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Iphdeiah, and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zichri were the sons of Jeroham.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were heads of the fathers’ households according to their generations, chief men who lived in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, Jeiel, the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon, and his wife’s name was Maacah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and his firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gedor, Ahio, and Zecher.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mikloth fathered Shimeah. They also lived with their relatives in Jerusalem opposite their other relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ner fathered Kish, Kish fathered Saul, and Saul fathered Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal, and Merib-baal fathered Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz fathered Jehoaddah, Jehoaddah fathered Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri fathered Moza.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moza fathered Binea; Raphah was his son, Eleasah, his son, and Azel, his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azel had six sons, and these were their names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of his brother Eshek were Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ulam were valiant mighty men, archers, and they had many sons and grandsons, 150 of them. All these were among the sons of Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all Israel was enrolled in genealogies; and behold, they are written in the Book of the Kings of Israel. And Judah was taken into exile to Babylon for their infidelity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the first inhabitants who lived on their own property in their cities were people of Israel, including the priests, the Levites, and the temple servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the sons of Judah, some of the sons of Benjamin, and some of the sons of Ephraim and Manasseh lived in Jerusalem:
speaker: Narrator

text: Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, from the sons of Perez the son of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Shilonites were Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the sons of Zerah were Jeuel and their relatives, 690 of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the sons of Benjamin were Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri, and Meshullam the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their relatives according to their generations, 956. All these men were heads of fathers’ households according to their fathers’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the priests were Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jachin,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the chief officer of the house of God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their relatives, heads of their fathers’ households, 1,760 competent men for the work of the service of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Levites, there were Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Bakbakkar, Heresh, and Galal; and Mattaniah the son of Mica, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun; and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the settlements of the Netophathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the gatekeepers were Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their relatives (Shallum the chief
speaker: Narrator

text: being stationed until now at the king’s gate to the east). These were the gatekeepers for the camp of the sons of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his relatives of his father’s house, the Korahites, were in charge of the work of the service, doorkeepers of the tent; and their fathers had been in charge of the camp of the Lord, keepers of the entrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Phinehas the son of Eleazar was supervisor over them previously, and the Lord was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was gatekeeper of the entrance of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were chosen to be gatekeepers at the thresholds were 212 in all. They were registered by genealogy in their settlements, those whom David and Samuel the seer appointed in their official capacity.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they and their sons were in charge of the gates of the house of the Lord, the house of the tent, in their divisions of service.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gatekeepers were on the four sides, to the east, west, north, and south.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their relatives in their settlements were to come in every seven days from time to time to be with them;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the four chief gatekeepers, who were Levites, served in an official capacity, and were in charge of the chambers and in charge of the treasuries in the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They spent the night around the house of God, because the watch was committed to them; and they were in charge of opening it morning by morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now some of them were in charge of the utensils of the service, for they counted them when they brought them in and when they took them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of them also were appointed over the furniture and over all the utensils of the sanctuary, and over the finely milled flour, the wine, the olive oil, the frankincense, and the balsam oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the sons of the priests prepared the mixing of the balsam oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the responsibility for the baking of cakes in pans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of their relatives of the sons of the Kohathites were in charge of the showbread to prepare it every Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the singers, heads of fathers’ households of the Levites, who lived in the chambers of the temple free of other duties; for they were engaged in their work day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were heads of fathers’ households of the Levites according to their generations, chief men who lived in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon, and his wife’s name was Maacah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mikloth fathered Shimeam. And they also lived with their relatives in Jerusalem opposite their other relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ner fathered Kish, Kish fathered Saul, and Saul fathered Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal; and Merib-baal fathered Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz fathered Jarah, Jarah fathered Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri fathered Moza.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moza fathered Binea, and Rephaiah was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azel had six sons whose names were these: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Philistines fought against Israel, and the men of Israel fled from the Philistines but fell fatally wounded on Mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Philistines also overtook Saul and his sons, and the Philistines killed Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, the sons of Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The battle became severe against Saul, and the archers found him; and he was wounded by the archers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul said to his armor bearer, “Draw your sword and thrust me through with it, otherwise these uncircumcised Philistines will come and abuse me.” But his armor bearer would not, for he was very afraid. So Saul took his own sword and fell on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he likewise fell on his sword and died.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Saul died with his three sons, and all those of his house died together.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the people of Israel who were in the valley saw that they had fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their cities and fled; and the Philistines came and lived in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: It came about the next day, when the Philistines came to strip those killed, that they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they stripped him and took his head and his armor and sent messengers around the land of the Philistines to carry the good news to their idols and to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They put his armor in the house of their gods and impaled his head in the house of Dagon.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all Jabesh-gilead heard everything that the Philistines had done to Saul,
speaker: Narrator

text: all the valiant men got up and took away the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons, and brought them to Jabesh; and they buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh, and fasted for seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Saul died for his unfaithfulness which he committed against the Lord, because of the word of the Lord which he did not keep; and also because he asked counsel of a medium, making inquiry of her,
speaker: Narrator

text: and did not inquire of the Lord. Therefore He killed him and turned the kingdom over to David, the son of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all Israel gathered to David at Hebron and said, “Behold, we are your bone and your flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: In times past, even when Saul was king, you were the one who led out and brought in Israel; and the Lord your God said to you, ‘You shall shepherd My people Israel, and you shall be leader over My people Israel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the Lord; and they anointed David king over Israel, in accordance with the word of the Lord through Samuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus); and the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, were there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The inhabitants of Jebus said to David, “You shall not enter here.” Nevertheless David took the mountain stronghold of Zion (that is, the city of David).
speaker: Narrator

text: Now David had said, “Whoever is first to kill a Jebusite shall be chief and commander.” Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, so he became chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David lived in the stronghold; therefore it was called the city of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: He built the city all around, from the Millo to the surrounding area; and Joab repaired the rest of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David became greater and greater, for the Lord of armies was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the heads of the mighty men whom David had, who remained faithful to him in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, in accordance with the word of the Lord concerning Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: These constitute the list of David’s mighty men: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, the chief of the thirty; he wielded his spear against three hundred whom he killed at one time.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was with David at Pas-dammim when the Philistines were gathered together there to battle, and there was a plot of land full of barley; and the people fled from the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they took their stand in the midst of the plot and defended it, and defeated the Philistines; and the Lord saved them with a great victory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now three of the thirty chief men went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam, while the army of the Philistines was camping in the Valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was then in the stronghold, while the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David had a craving and said, “Oh that someone would give me water to drink from the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the three broke through the camp of the Philistines and drew water from the well of Bethlehem which was by the gate, and took it and brought it to David; however, David would not drink it, but poured it out to the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said, “Far be it from me before my God that I would do this. Shall I drink the blood of these men who went at the risk of their lives? For they brought it at the risk of their lives.” Therefore he would not drink it. The three mighty men did these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for Abshai the brother of Joab, he was chief of the thirty, and he wielded his spear against three hundred and killed them; and he had a name as well as the thirty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the three in the second rank he was the most honored, and he became their commander; however, he did not attain the reputation of the first three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a warrior of Kabzeel, mighty in deeds, struck and killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab. He also went down and struck and killed a lion inside a pit on a snowy day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he killed an Egyptian, a man of great stature five cubits tall. Now in the Egyptian’s hand was a spear like a weaver’s beam, but he went down to him with a club and snatched the spear from the Egyptian’s hand and killed him with his own spear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada did these things, and had a name as well as the three mighty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he was honored among the thirty, but he did not attain the reputation of the first three; and David appointed him over his bodyguard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the mighty men of the armies were Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the sons of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shagee the Hararite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Hagri,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armor bearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a chief of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hanan the son of Maacah and Joshaphat the Mithnite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jediael the son of Shimri and his brother Joha the Tizite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, Ithmah the Moabite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the men who came to David at Ziklag, while he was still restricted because of Saul the son of Kish; and they were among the mighty men who helped him in war.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were equipped with bows, using both the right hand and the left to sling stones and shoot arrows with the bow; they were Saul’s kinsmen from Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; and Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth, and Beracah, and Jehu the Anathothite,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty, and in charge of the thirty. Then Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, Jozabad the Gederathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, Shephatiah the Haruphite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, Jashobeam, the Korahites,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Gadites valiant mighty men went over to David at the stronghold in the wilderness, men trained for war who could handle a large shield and spear, whose faces were like the faces of lions, and they were as swift as the gazelles on the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ezer was the first, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeremiah the tenth, and Machbannai, the eleventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These men from the sons of Gad were captains of the army; the one who was least was equal to a hundred, and the greatest, to a thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the ones who crossed the Jordan in the first month, when it was overflowing all its banks, and they put to flight all those in the valleys, to the east and to the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some of the sons of Benjamin and Judah came to the stronghold to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: David went out to meet them, and said to them, “If you come peacefully to help me, my heart shall be united with you; but if to betray me to my enemies, since there is no wrong in my hands, may the God of our fathers look on it and decide.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the Spirit covered Amasai like clothing, the chief of the thirty; and he said,
“We are yours, David,
And are with you, son of Jesse!
Peace, peace to you,
And peace to him who helps you;
Indeed, your God helps you!”
Then David received them and made them captains of the troops.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Manasseh some also defected to David when he was about to go to battle with the Philistines against Saul. But they did not help them, because the governors of the Philistines sent him away after consultation, saying, “At the cost of our heads he might defect to his master Saul.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he was going to Ziklag, men from Manasseh defected to him: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, captains of thousands who belonged to Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They helped David against the band of raiders, for they were all valiant mighty men, and were captains in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: For day by day men came to David to help him, until there was a great army like the army of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the numbers of the divisions equipped for war, who came to David at Hebron, to turn the kingdom of Saul to him, according to the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah who carried shield and spear numbered 6,800, equipped for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the sons of Simeon, valiant mighty men of war, 7,100.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the sons of Levi, 4,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jehoiada was the leader of the house of Aaron, and with him were 3,700,
speaker: Narrator

text: also Zadok, a young valiant mighty man, and from his father’s house, twenty-two captains.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the sons of Benjamin, Saul’s kinsmen, three thousand; for until now the majority of them had kept their allegiance to the house of Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the sons of Ephraim 20,800, valiant mighty men, famous men in their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the half-tribe of Manasseh eighteen thousand, who were designated by name to come and make David king.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the sons of Issachar, men who understood the times, with knowledge of what Israel should do, their chiefs were two hundred; and all their kinsmen were at their command.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Zebulun, there were fifty thousand who went out in the army, who could draw up in battle formation with all kinds of weapons of war and helped David with an undivided heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Naphtali there were a thousand captains, and with them thirty-seven thousand with shield and spear.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Danites who could draw up in battle formation, there were 28,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Asher there were forty thousand who went out in the army to draw up in battle formation.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the other side of the Jordan, from the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, there were 120,000 with all kinds of weapons of war for the battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of these, being men of war who helped in battle formation, came to Hebron with a perfect heart to make David king over all Israel; and all the rest of Israel also were of one mind to make David king.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were there with David for three days, eating and drinking, for their kinsmen had prepared for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, those who were near to them, as far as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali, brought food on donkeys, camels, mules, and on oxen, great quantities of flour cakes, fig cakes and bunches of raisins, wine, oil, oxen, and sheep. There was joy indeed in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David consulted with the captains of the thousands and the hundreds, with every leader.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to all the assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you, and if it is from the Lord our God, let us send word everywhere to our kinsmen who remain in all the land of Israel, and to the priests and Levites who are with them in their cities with pasture lands, that they meet with us;
speaker: Narrator

text: and let us bring back the ark of our God to us, since we did not seek it in the days of Saul.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the assembly said that they would do so, for this was right in the eyes of all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David assembled all Israel together, from the Shihor of Egypt to the entrance of Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David and all Israel went up to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath-jearim, which belongs to Judah, to bring up from there the ark of God, the Lord who is enthroned above the cherubim, where His name is called.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they carried the ark of God on a new cart from the house of Abinadab, and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.
speaker: Narrator

text: David and all Israel were celebrating before God with all their might, with songs and with lyres, harps, tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzza put out his hand to hold the ark, because the oxen nearly overturned it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the anger of the Lord burned against Uzza, so He struck him because he had put out his hand toward the ark; and he died there before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David became angry because of the Lord’s outburst against Uzza; and he called that place Perez-uzza as it is to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How can I bring the ark of God home to me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David did not take the ark with him to the city of David, but took it aside to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom in his house for three months; and the Lord blessed the family of Obed-edom and all that he had.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David with cedar trees, masons, and carpenters, to build a house for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David realized that the Lord had established him as king over Israel, and that his kingdom was highly exalted, for the sake of His people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David took more wives in Jerusalem, and David fathered more sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up in search of David; and David heard about it and went out against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Philistines had come and carried out a raid in the Valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David inquired of God, saying, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? And will You hand them over to me?” Then the Lord said to him, “Go up, for I will hand them over to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they came up to Baal-perazim, and David defeated them there; and David said, “God has broken through my enemies by my hand, like the breakthrough of waters.” Therefore they named that place Baal-perazim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They abandoned their gods there; so David gave the order and they were burned with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines carried out yet another raid in the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: David inquired again of God, and God said to him, “You shall not go up after them; circle around behind them and come at them in front of the baka-shrubs.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the baka-shrubs, then you shall go out to battle, for God will have gone out before you to strike the army of the Philistines.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David did just as God had commanded him, and they defeated the army of the Philistines from Gibeon even as far as Gezer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the fame of David spread in all the lands; and the Lord brought the fear of him on all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now David built houses for himself in the city of David; and he prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched a tent for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said, “No one is to carry the ark of God except the Levites; for the Lord chose them to carry the ark of the Lord and to serve Him forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And David assembled all Israel at Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the Lord to its place which he had prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: David gathered together the sons of Aaron and the Levites:
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief, and 120 of his relatives;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief, and 220 of his relatives;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief, and 130 of his relatives;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief, and two hundred of his relatives;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief, and eighty of his relatives;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief, and 112 of his relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David called for the priests Zadok and Abiathar, and for the Levites, for Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said to them, “You are the heads of the fathers’ households of the Levites; consecrate yourselves, you and your relatives, so that you may bring up the ark of the Lord God of Israel to the place that I have prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because you did not carry it at the first, the Lord our God made an outburst against us, since we did not seek Him according to the ordinance.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the priests and the Levites consecrated themselves to bring up the ark of the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of the Levites carried the ark of God on their shoulders with the poles on them, just as Moses had commanded in accordance with the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David spoke to the chiefs of the Levites to appoint their relatives as the singers, with musical instruments, harps, lyres, and cymbals, playing to raise sounds of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel, and from his relatives, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and from the sons of Merari their relatives, Ethan the son of Kushaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and with them their relatives of the second rank, Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel, the gatekeepers.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were appointed to sound aloud cymbals of bronze;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with harps tuned to alamoth;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah, to lead with lyres tuned to the sheminith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was in charge of the singing; he gave instruction in singing because he was skillful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Berechiah and Elkanah were gatekeepers for the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, blew the trumpets before the ark of God. Obed-edom and Jehiah also were gatekeepers for the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it was David, with the elders of Israel and the captains of thousands, who went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord from the house of Obed-edom with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because God was helping the Levites who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the Lord, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now David was clothed with a robe of fine linen with all the Levites who were carrying the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah the leader of the singing with the singers. David also wore an ephod of linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the Lord with shouting, and with the sound of the horn, with trumpets, with loud-sounding cymbals, with harps, and lyres.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the ark of the covenant of the Lord came to the city of David, Michal the daughter of Saul looked out of the window and saw King David dancing and celebrating; and she despised him in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought in the ark of God and placed it inside the tent which David had pitched for it, and they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David had finished offering the burnt offering and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he distributed to everyone of Israel, both men and women, to everyone a loaf of bread, a portion of meat, and a raisin cake.
speaker: Narrator

text: He appointed some of the Levites as ministers before the ark of the Lord, to celebrate and to thank and praise the Lord God of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: Asaph the chief, and second to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel, with musical instruments, harps, and lyres; also Asaph played loud-sounding cymbals,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the priests Benaiah and Jahaziel blew trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then on that day David first assigned Asaph and his relatives to give thanks to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, call upon His name;
Make His deeds known among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to Him, sing praises to Him;
Speak of all His wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Boast in His holy name;
Let the heart of those who seek the Lord be joyful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord and His strength;
Seek His face continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember His wonderful deeds which He has done,
His marvels and the judgments from His mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
You descendants of Israel His servant,
Sons of Jacob, His chosen ones!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the Lord our God;
His judgments are in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember His covenant forever,
The word which He commanded to a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text:
The covenant which He made with Abraham,
And His oath to Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also confirmed it to Jacob as a statute,
To Israel as an everlasting covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan,
As the portion of your inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they were only a few in number,
Very few, and strangers in it,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they wandered from nation to nation,
And from one kingdom to another people,
speaker: Narrator

text:
He allowed no one to oppress them,
And He rebuked kings for their sakes, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Do not touch My anointed ones,
And do not harm My prophets.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord, all the earth;
Proclaim good news of His salvation from day to day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell of His glory among the nations,
His wonderful deeds among all the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised;
He also is to be feared above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols,
But the Lord made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Splendor and majesty are before Him,
Strength and joy are in His place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to the Lord, you families of the peoples,
Ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Tremble before Him, all the earth;
Indeed, the world is firmly established, it will not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the heavens be joyful, and the earth rejoice;
And let them say among the nations, “The Lord reigns.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the sea roar, and everything it contains;
Let the field rejoice, and everything that is in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the trees of the forest will sing for joy in the presence of the Lord;
For He is coming to judge the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good;
For His faithfulness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then say, “Save us, God of our salvation,
And gather us and save us from the nations,
To give thanks to Your holy name,
And glory in Your praise.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
From everlasting to everlasting!
Then all the people said, “Amen,” and praised the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he left Asaph and his relatives there before the ark of the covenant of the Lord, to minister before the ark continually, as every day’s work required,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Obed-edom with his sixty-eight relatives; Obed-edom, the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah as gatekeepers.
speaker: Narrator

text: He left Zadok the priest and his relatives the priests before the tabernacle of the Lord in the high place which was at Gibeon,
speaker: Narrator

text: to offer burnt offerings to the Lord on the altar of burnt offering continually morning and evening, even according to everything that is written in the Law of the Lord, which He commanded Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: With them were Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest who were chosen, who were designated by name, to give thanks to the Lord, because His kindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with them were Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those who were to play them, and with instruments for the songs of God, and the sons of Jeduthun for the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the people departed, each to his house; and David returned to bless his household.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came about, when David lived in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, “Look, I am living in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of the Lord is under tent curtains.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Nathan said to David, “Do whatever is in your heart, for God is with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But it happened that same night, that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go and tell David My servant, ‘This is what the Lord says: “You shall not build a house for Me to dwell in;
speaker: Narrator

text: for I have not dwelt in a house since the day that I brought up Israel to this day, but I have gone from tent to tent and from one dwelling place to another.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all places where I have walked with all Israel, have I spoken a word with any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to shepherd My people, saying, ‘Why have you not built Me a house of cedar?’”’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, therefore, this is what you shall say to My servant David: ‘This is what the Lord of armies says: “I took you from the pasture, from following the sheep, to be leader over My people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and have eliminated all your enemies from you; and I will make for you a name like the name of the great ones who are on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will appoint a place for My people Israel, and will plant them there, so that they may live in their own place and not tremble with anxiety again; and the wicked will not make them waste away anymore as they did previously,
speaker: Narrator

text:
even from the day that I commanded judges to be over My people Israel. And I will subdue all your enemies.
Moreover, I tell you that the Lord will build a house for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When your days are fulfilled that you must go to be with your fathers, then I will set up one of your descendants after you, who will be from your sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall build for Me a house, and I will establish his throne forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be his father and he shall be My son; and I will not take My favor away from him, as I took it from him who was before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will settle him in My house and in My kingdom forever, and his throne will be established forever.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: According to all these words and according to all of this vision, so Nathan spoke to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King David came in and sat before the Lord, and said, “Who am I, Lord God, and what is my house that You have brought me this far?
speaker: Narrator
